item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Becomes First Game To Support DLSS 4
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/cyberpunk-2077-becomes-first-game-to-support-dlss-4/

Nvidia is releasing its new GeForce RTX 5090 graphics cards on January 30, and with it comes the release of the next generation of Deep Learning Super Sampling (DLSS). On Thursday, CD Projekt Red released a new update for Cyberpunk 2077 to account for the new technology, making it the first game to officially support DLSS 4.

With support for DLSS 4 being added, Cyberpunk 2077 will allow the use of Nvidia’s new multi-frame generation technology that is launching exclusively for the next-gen RTX 50 series graphics cards. This technology helps with overall performance using AI to generate more frames while you play.

In addition to Cyberpunk 2077, DLSS 4 will be available with at least 75 games when it launches.

You can check out the PC-specific notes from CD Projekt Red below.

  • Added support for DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation for GeForce RTX 50 Series graphics cards, which boosts FPS by using AI to generate up to three times per traditionally rendered frame – enabled with GeForce RTX 50 Series on January 30th. DLSS 4 also introduces faster single Frame Generation with reduced memory usage for RTX 50 and 40 Series. Additionally, you can now choose between the CNN model or the new Transformer model for DLSS Ray Reconstruction, DLSS Super Resolution, and DLAA on all GeForce RTX graphics cards today. The new Transformer model enhances stability, lighting, and detail in motion.
  • Fixed artifacts and smudging on in-game screens when using DLSS Ray Reconstruction.
  • The Frame Generation field in Graphics settings will now properly reset after switching Resolution Scaling to OFF.

Are you going to pick up a new RTX 50 series GPU when they launch to take advantage of the new features in games like Cyberpunk 2077? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: 2025 is the Year of the RPG – Upcoming RPG Games We’re Excited About
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/2025-is-the-year-of-the-rpg-upcoming-rpg-games/

Like many of you, I don’t have much time these days to invest hundreds of hours into a single game. I usually run through a new release, play the campaign once, and enjoy multiplayer wherever possible. But when it comes to role-playing games, I can’t help myself. I collect them, leaving many in my backlog for a rainy day. Well, 2025 will be another big year for RPGs, with titles such as Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 and The First Berserker: Khazan on the way!

Upcoming RPGs in 2025 – With Release Dates!

First and foremost, it’s important to note that we don’t have official release dates for every RPG mentioned here. As such, many of them may be pushed out of 2025 to 2026 and beyond. For titles like The Elder Scrolls VI and The Witcher 4, we’re not even going to bother mentioning them past this point, as there’s no way they’ll realistically launch this year.

  • Tales of Grace f Remastered – January 17
  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth – January 23
  • Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector – January 23
  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 – February 4
  • The Legend of Heroes: Trails Through Daybreak II – February 14
  • Avowed – February 18
  • Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii – February 21
  • Monster Hunter Wilds – February 28
  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows – March 20
  • Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land – March 21
  • The First Berserker: Khazan – March 27
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma – May 30

Upcoming RPGs Without Release Dates

Several upcoming role-playing games are rumored to be released in 2025, though there are no specific release dates yet. It’s still early in the year, so fingers crossed!

  • ArcheAge Chronicles
  • Borderlands 4
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake
  • Fable
  • Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A
  • Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2
  • Wuchang: Fallen Fathers

Oh, and here’s hoping we see Black Myth: Wukong on Xbox Series X|S this year, too!

What’s the one RPG you’re most excited to play? Let us know in the comments, or visit the Insider Gaming community forums to discuss RPGs with us!

Speaking of upcoming RPGs, Rebel Wolves’ Dawnwalker will be published by Bandai Namco, but we don’t expect it in 2025.
